content.text:
# Draft:Cao Lãnh ward, Đồng Tháp

Cao Lãnh is a ward in Đồng Tháp province, Vietnam. This is a newly established ward after the Plan to arrange and merge administrative units in Vietnam 2024–2025.  -->

Administrative history
Before 1975, Cao Lanh was a provincial town and is the provincial capital of Kiến Phong province.
In 1983, the Council of Ministers issued Decision 13-HĐBT on the establishment of Cao Lãnh provincial town. (after 2007 is Cao Lãnh provincial city).
Before July 1st, 2025, Cao Lãnh is a capital city of Đồng Tháp province.
On June 16, 2025, the National Assembly of Vietnam issued Resolution No. 1663/NQ-UBTVQH15 on the arrangement of commune-level administrative units, effective from July 1, accordingly:
# Arrange the total area and population size of the wards: ward 1, ward 3, ward 4, ward 6, Hoà Thuận, and communes: Hoà An, Tịnh Thới, Tân Thuận Tây, Tân Thuận Đông The new ward was named Cao Lãnh ward.
# Arrange the total area and population size of Mỹ Ngãi ward and commune Mỹ Tân the new ward was named Mỹ Ngãi ward.
# Arrange the entire area and population size of Mỹ Phú ward and communes: Nhị Mỹ, An Bình, Mỹ Trà into a new ward called Mỹ Trà ward.
Geography
Cao Lãnh ward has the following geographical location:
# The north borders My Tra ward and Mỹ Ngãi ward.
# The east borders the Mỹ Thọ commune.
# The south borders Mỹ An Hưng and Tân Khánh Trung communes (separated by the Tiền river).
# West borders An Giang province (separated by the Tiền river).
